client.ClientControllers

Class ClientController

  • java.lang.Object
    • client.ClientControllers.ClientController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SCCommunicationConstants

    public class ClientController
extends java.lang.Object
implements SCCommunicationConstants
    When run, connects the client to the server, and allows the client to send and receive lists of items, suppliers, and orders. Sent lists can be created from text files.
    Since:
    April 5, 2019
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jake Liu, Shamez Meghji, Victor Sanchez

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      The display model that is used to display the list of items.

      List of items held by the store.

      The text area that is used to display orders.

      List of orders held by the store.

      • ClientController

        public ClientController(java.lang.String serverName,
                        int portNum)
        Constructor. Creates the client's socket and the object I/O streams for that socket, using the socket's I/O handles.
        Parameters:
        serverName - The server host name.
        portNum - The port number.

    • Method Detail

      • terminate

        public void terminate()
        Informs the server that the client is done communicating with the server. closes all streams and sockets.

      • retrieveItemListFromServer

        public java.util.ArrayList<ItemModel> retrieveItemListFromServer()
                                                          throws java.io.IOException
        Asks the server for the items held in the database. throws an error if there is an error in the server interaction.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of the items.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the server cannot be contacted.

      • retrieveSupplierListFromServer

        public java.util.ArrayList<SupplierModel> retrieveSupplierListFromServer()
                                                                  throws java.io.IOException
        Asks the server for the suppliers held in the database. throws an error if there is an error in the server.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of the suppliers.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the server cannot be contacted or read from.

      • retrieveOrderListFromServer

        public java.util.ArrayList<OrderLineModel> retrieveOrderListFromServer()
                                                                throws java.io.IOException
        Asks the server for the orders held in the database. throws an error if there is an error in the server.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of the orders.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the server cannot be contacted or read from.

        Parameters:

      • sendItemUpdate

        public void sendItemUpdate(ItemModel updateItem)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Sends an item to the server to update. This is for new items and changed items, such as items that have had their quantity decreased.
        Parameters:
        updateItem - The item to update in the server.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the server cannot be contacted or read from.

      • sendItemOrderUpdate

        public void sendItemOrderUpdate(ItemModel itemToOrder,
                                int quantityToOrder)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Sends an item and a quantity to order to the server. The server will generate an order line to add to their order list. The server will not automatically send the updated line. If the item being ordered does not exist in the server's list, it will throw an error. If less than 1 item is being ordered, it will throw an error.
        Parameters:
        itemToOrder - The item being ordered.
        quantityToOrder - The quantity of the item to be ordered.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the server cannot be contacted or read from.

      • sendItemSearch

        public ItemModel sendItemSearch(int itemId)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Searches for an item in the server.
        Parameters:
        itemId - The ID of the item being searched for.
        Returns:
        The found item or null.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the server cannot be contacted or read from.

      • sendItemSearch

        public ItemModel sendItemSearch(java.lang.String itemName)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Searches for an item in the server.
        Parameters:
        itemName - The name of the item being searched for.
        Returns:
        The found item or null.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the server cannot be contacted or read from.

      • sendDeletedItemUpdate

        public void sendDeletedItemUpdate(ItemModel deleteItem)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Sends an item to the server to remove. Therefore, before removing an item in the client side, this method should be used to remove the item from the server properly.
        Parameters:
        deleteItem - The item to remove in the server.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the server cannot be contacted or read from.

      • sendQuantityCheck

        public java.util.ArrayList<OrderLineModel> sendQuantityCheck()
                                                      throws java.io.IOException
        Tells the server to check its quantities, in order to produce orders if necessary. Automatically returns the possibly updated order list.
        Returns:
        A list of orders after the quantity check.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the server cannot be contacted or read from.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • fetchAndDisplayItems

        public boolean fetchAndDisplayItems(java.lang.String search)
        Gets all data from server and inputs into display models.
        Parameters:
        search - The name of the item to search for.
        Returns:
        true if communication with server was successful, false if otherwise.

      • fetchAndDisplaySuppliers

        public boolean fetchAndDisplaySuppliers()
        Update the current lists of suppliers from the server data.
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful, false if not.

      • fetchAndDisplayOrders

        public boolean fetchAndDisplayOrders()
        Update the current lists of orders from the server data.
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful, false if not.

      • readItems

        public java.lang.String readItems(java.lang.String fileName,
                                  java.lang.String search)
        Attempts to read a file with the given filename,converting it into a list of items, before sending the list to the server. If the file cannot be read, nothing else happens.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of the file to be read.
        search - Item String to search with.
        Returns:
        A description of how the attempt went.

      • readSuppliers

        public java.lang.String readSuppliers(java.lang.String fileName)
        Attempts to read a file with the given filename,converting it into a list of items, before sending the list to the server. If the file cannot be read, nothing else happens.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of the file to be read.
        Returns:
        A description of how the attempt went.

        public void displaySuppliers()
        Fills/overwrites a given list model with the strings of the supplier list.

        Fills/overwrites a given list model with the strings of the item list.
        Parameters:

        public void displayOrders()

      • removeItem

        public java.lang.String removeItem(int id,
                                   java.lang.String search)
        Removes an item from the item list on the server and client.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the item to be removed.
        search - Item string to search for.
        Returns:
        a string giving the result of the removal.

      • addSupplier

        public java.lang.String addSupplier(int id,
                                    java.lang.String name,
                                    java.lang.String address,
                                    java.lang.String contact)
        Adds a supplier to the supplier list on the server and the client.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the supplier to be added.
        name - the name of the supplier to be added.
        address - the address of the supplier to be added.
        contact - the contact name of the supplier to be added.
        Returns:
        the result of the supplier addition.

      • addItem

        public java.lang.String addItem(int id,
                                java.lang.String name,
                                int quantity,
                                float price,
                                int supId,
                                java.lang.String search)
        Adds an item to the item list on the server and the client.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the item to be added.
        name - the name of the item to be added.
        quantity - the quantity of the item to be added.
        price - the price of the item to be added.
        supId - the supplier id of the item to be added.
        search - for the item to be added.
        Returns:
        the result of the item addition.

      • sellItem

        public java.lang.String sellItem(int id,
                                 int quantity)
        Removes a certain quantity of the item, updating this on the server and client.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the item to be sold.
        quantity - the quantity to be sold of the item.
        Returns:
        the result of the item sale.

      • orderItem

        public java.lang.String orderItem(int id,
                                  int quantity,
                                  java.lang.String search)
        Orders a certain amount of a particular item, updating this on the server and client.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the item to be ordered.
        quantity - the amount of the item that will be ordered.
        search - item String to search with.
        Returns:
        The result of the item order.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Main method for the client, used for testing. Creates and runs a client, which tries to connect to a game server on port 8428.
        Parameters:
        args - Command line arguments when starting the program.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the client cannot be created.
